inclusion.criterion: blood glucose ≥ 150 mg/dl, and/or Postprandial blood glucose ≥ 200 mg/dl
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Anthropometric measurements and vital sign will be taken.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Concomitant medication and adverse events will be noted.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Glucose meter, strips, Insulin and study diary will be dispensed.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Training on Glucose meter usage, hypoglycemia, hyperglycemia symptoms, Insulin injection technique and dose titration technique will be done.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Subjects will be instructed to maintain the record of dosing details in the patient diary.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: They will be given Diet and Exercise counselling.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: They will be asked to hand over the study diary and Insulin pen (empty or full) to the coordinator at each visit.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: First three months will be an insulin dose titration period in which the subjects will be asked to visit the clinic at 12 weeks.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: At week 4, and 8 investigator can have an unscheduled visit for training or insulin dispensing.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: During the telephonic visit subjects will be asked about concomitant medication and adverse events.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subject is being treated for severe active infection of any type
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Have had more than one episode of severe hypoglycemia within 6 months prior to entry into the study.
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger

exclusion.criterion: Planned surgery in the next 6 months
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any event forecasted to require a temporary need to switch to insulin
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient has type 1 diabetes, which is an exclusion criterion. However, the overall assessment is likely eligible because the inclusion criteria are met and there are no other exclusion criteria that trigger.
